item.title: Director of Bioinformatics
item.description:
Senior Bioinformatics Scientist & Director of Bioinformatics Division at Feng Chi Biotech 豐技生技

Strategic Leadership & Product Development
  • End-to-End Pipeline Development: Spearheaded the “0 to 1” development of bioinformatics analysis pipelines for oncology marker detection, covering algorithm design, model construction, and clinical validation.
  • Clinical V&V & Quality Assurance: Implemented a rigorous Verification and Validation (V&V) framework; authored IQ/OQ/PQ protocols and reports to ensure system stability and precision in clinical diagnostics.
  • ISO/LDT Compliance: Led ISO/LDT certification initiatives, establishing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and compliance frameworks to meet international medical regulatory standards and accelerate product launch.
  • Project & Operations Management: Managed R&D timelines and technical risks; optimized case management systems through automation to resolve labor bottlenecks and enhance team productivity.
Technical Architecture & Scientific R&D
  • Advanced Algorithm R&D: Engineered and optimized NGS-based variant calling models and clinical interpretation workflows, significantly improving diagnostic accuracy and clinical utility.
  • Data Governance & Standardization: Architected unified data schemas and optimized heterogeneous data storage to build a stable and scalable foundation for large-scale genomic data analysis.
  • Full-stack Workflow Automation: Integrated n8n and custom tools to automate the entire lifecycle from laboratory intake to clinical reporting, reducing manual intervention and human error.
  • Systematic Development Standards: Established standardized SDLC processes, including version control and Reproducibility mechanisms, ensuring consistency and traceability of clinical results.
Infrastructure & DevOps Operations
  • Data Center & Network Administration: Designed and managed on-premise R&D data centers and network architecture, ensuring 24/7 high availability and security for mission-critical clinical services.
  • Virtualization Management: Built and maintained virtualized server environments (e.g., Proxmox, VMware) to enable elastic resource allocation for high-concurrency NGS computational workloads.
  • Containerization & Deployment: Orchestrated deployment automation using Docker, ensuring environment consistency across dev/test/prod stages and reducing system migration and maintenance costs.
  • Data Resilience & Disaster Recovery: Designed and implemented ISO-compliant backup and recovery mechanisms to guarantee medical data integrity, security, and high availability.
Communication & Leadership
  • Cross-functional Synergy: Acted as the core technical liaison to bridge gaps between Oncology, Software Engineering, and Business Development (BD), translating market needs into technical roadmaps.
  • Technical Mentorship: Curated and led internal training programs on diagnostic markers, bioinformatics standards, and data visualization to strengthen the organization’s technical expertise.

item.title: About
item.description:
Professional Summary

專業的生物資訊與 DevOps 工程師，專注於開發高效能的基因分析流程與維護雲端基礎設施。

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Bioinformatics / DevOps Engineer at ACT Genomics 行動基因

Software construction
  • Bioinformatics analysis software development.
  • Support the software upgrade and maintenance for NGS-based oncology diagnostic assays.
  • Design and write software refactoring, upgrade and software validation.
  • SaaS development through the Nextflow platform.
  • Data analysis and visualization for supporting product development.
  • Integrate software automation, function testing, version control, and container deployment within project management using Jira Scrum to enhance efficiency and ensure effective tracking of all project components.
  • Supervise software validation (software quality assurance), including installation qualification (IQ), operational qualification (OQ).
Bridging, Communication, Management
  • Bridge the gaps on oncology product and software development among bioinformaticians and cross departments such as laboratory RD, production line, medical scientists, technical transport and business development.
  • Control, assess and manage product development time line and risk.
  • Prioritize works to efficiently achieve product success.
Support
  • Perform data analyses to support laboratory protocol optimization and pharmaceutical business development

item.title: Research Assistant
item.description:
Ph.D Research Assistant of BiOmics Lab under Professor Tzong-Yi Lee.

Focused Research Areas in Big Data and Applications of Smart Medicine
  • Bioinformatics big data analysis
  • Multi-omics deep learning computation
  • Cancer biomarkers
  • Pathogen drug resistance analysis
  • Peptide drug design
  • Applications of machine learning and deep learning in smart healthcare
Software construction
  • Bioinformatics analysis software development.
  • Support the software upgrade and maintenance for NGS-based oncology diagnostic assays.
  • Data analysis and visualization for supporting product development
  • Design and lead software refactoring, upgrade and software validation.
